column4: Hey guys i'm try to find the name of the program that gives me the tool bar similar to that of the mac tool bar
awn is one I think
login as root? something went wrong there..
what do you mean
well never really loged in as root just started nautilus as root
but in older versions of ubuntu it would alway show up as root like i told it too
as windows soory
ahh.. now that's an entirely different thing. I'm not sure why it's different.. probably some setting that isn't configured for the root user
it's more like it's using what i told it to and my account is not
I'm not sure what is responsible for naming hard drives in nautilus.. udev perhaps
it's not only that even the icon that is created on my desktop is wrong
I would rather it say windows rather than just 21 gb media
usually the drives are named according to the partition label..if that is set
i have that set, did that during install
but like i said it only seems to be the root user that is getting that info
hmm.. not sure why it would behave like that.. btw how do you start nautilus as root?
in terminal type sudo nautulis
not sure if that's the problem.. but you should *never* use sudo with gui apps..
good to know I just use it from once in awhile to copy things that need root
try starting it with gksudo instead.. see if that makes things better
will do
yeah thats the same the drive show up as windows
like it shod
